abstract: Returns an array of all visible descendants that intersect a point.
overview:
## Return Value

An array of all `SKNode` objects in the subtree that intersect the point. Only nodes that have an [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/isHidden] of `false` and an [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/alpha] greater that zero are included in the returned array. If no nodes intersect the point, an empty array is returned.

## Discussion

A point is considered to be in a node if it lies inside the rectangle returned by the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/calculateAccumulatedFrame()] method.

# nodes(at:)

**Instance Method**

Returns an array of all visible descendants that intersect a point.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func nodes(at p: CGPoint) -> [SKNode]
```

```swift
func nodes(at p: CGPoint) -> [SKNode]
```

## Parameters

- **p**: A point in the node’s coordinate system.

## Return Value

An array of all `SKNode` objects in the subtree that intersect the point. Only nodes that have an [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/isHidden] of `false` and an [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/alpha] greater that zero are included in the returned array. If no nodes intersect the point, an empty array is returned.

## Discussion

A point is considered to be in a node if it lies inside the rectangle returned by the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/calculateAccumulatedFrame()] method.

## Hit Testing

- **Understanding Hit-Testing**: Learn how find child nodes at a given point by using hit-testing.
- **contains(_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a point lies inside the parent’s coordinate system.
- **atPoint(_:)**: Returns the deepest visible descendant that intersects a point.
